wikipedia.title: Surdulica
wikipedia.summary: Surdulica is a town and municipality located in the Pčinja District of southern Serbia.

wikipedia.title: Branislav Nušić
wikipedia.summary: Branislav Nušić (, ; 20 October 1864 – 19 January 1938) was a Serbian playwright, satirist, essayist, novelist and founder of modern rhetoric in Serbia.

wikipedia.title: Visoki Dečani
wikipedia.summary: Visoki Dečani, or simply Dečani is a medieval Serbian Orthodox Christian monastery located near Dečani, Kosovo.

wikipedia.title: Vranje
wikipedia.summary: Vranje is a city and the administrative center of the Pčinja District in southern Serbia.

wikipedia.title: Nadežda Petrović
wikipedia.summary: Nadežda Petrović (11/12 October 1873 – 3 April 1915) was a Serbian painter from the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

wikipedia.title: History of Serbia
wikipedia.summary: The history of Serbia covers the historical development of Serbia and of its predecessor states, from the early Stone Age to the present state, as well as that of the Serbian people and of the areas they ruled historically.

wikipedia.title: Surdulica

wikipedia.title: Surdulica massacre
wikipedia.summary: The Surdulica massacre was the mass murder of Serbian men by Bulgarian occupational authorities in the southern Serbian town of Surdulica in 1916 and early 1917, during World War I.

wikipedia.title: Surdulica massacre
wikipedia.summary: The Surdulica massacre was the mass murder of Serbian men by Bulgarian occupational authorities in the southern Serbian town of Surdulica in 1916 and early 1917, during World War I.

wikipedia.title: Šajkača
wikipedia.summary: The šajkača is the Serbian national hat or cap. Traditionally worn by men in the Serbian countryside, it is named after Serb river troops known as šajkaši, who protected the Austrian Empire against the Ottoman Turks in the 18th century.
